programme.title: 30 Coins
programme.desc: Elena explores Father Vergara's possible connection when a local teenager suddenly disappears; Marquess Roque presents Elena with an enticing job offer; Merche urges Paco to keep his distance.

programme.title: Motherless Brooklyn
programme.desc: Lionel Essrog is a private detective who doesn't let Tourette's syndrome stand in the way of his job. Gifted with a few clues and an obsessive mind, Essrog must contend with thugs and corruption while investigating the murder of his only friend.

programme.title: Amanda Seales: I Be Knowin'
programme.desc: From the Edison Ballroom in New York, the comic discusses such topics as catcalling versus compliments, who runs the windows on an airplane, workplace email etiquette, and how to be a "Hannah" instead of a "Becky.".

programme.title: The Last King of Scotland
programme.desc: The personal physician (James McAvoy) of Ugandan dictator Idi Amin (Forest Whitaker) witnesses his murderous reign of terror.

programme.title: The Truth About Killer Robots
programme.desc: Filmmaker Maxim Pozdorovkin explores the many ways in which artificial intelligence is taking over people's lives and making them increasingly obsolete.

programme.title: Bigger
programme.desc: Siblings Joe and Ben Weider overcome anti-Semitism, conventional wisdom and poverty to become fitness entrepreneurs. Against all odds, the brothers launch the gym movement, create an empire and discover a bodybuilder named Arnold Schwarzenegger.

programme.title: Fahrenheit 451
programme.desc: In a future society where books are banned and burned, a fireman begins to read in secret and discovers an underground rebellion committed to protecting literature.

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo
programme.desc: A widower (Matt Damon) relocates his family to a dilapidated zoo and, with the help of its eclectic staff, works to restore the facility to its former glory.

programme.title: The Call of the Wild
programme.desc: Buck is a big-hearted dog whose blissful domestic life gets turned upside down when he is suddenly uprooted from his California home and transplanted to the exotic wilds of the Alaskan Yukon in the 1890s. Live action/animated.

programme.title: David Bowie: The Last Five Years
programme.desc: Director Francis Whately's documentary on the final years in the life of the music and cultural icon features commentary on his final two studio albums, "The Next Day" and "Blackstar," and his musical "Lazarus.".

programme.title: Hot Fuzz
programme.desc: A British constable (Simon Pegg) feels certain foul play is afoot when a series of grisly accidents rocks his quiet village.

programme.title: The King of Staten Island
programme.desc: An aimless slacker dreams of becoming a tattoo artist while living with his mother and hanging out with his friends in Staten Island, N.Y.

programme.title: Tiger
programme.desc: Highlighting Tiger Woods' unparalleled rise to fame and his complicated relationship with his father, Earl; the significance of his place in history -- as both a sports and cultural phenomenon --is undeniable.

programme.title: Tiger
programme.desc: Highlighting Tiger Woods' unparalleled rise to fame and his complicated relationship with his father, Earl; the significance of his place in history -- as both a sports and cultural phenomenon --is undeniable.

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: An epic adventure unfolds across the high seas, as American sailors (Taylor Kitsch, Alexander Skarsgård, Rihanna) go to war against an army of invading aliens.

programme.title: The Dead Don't Die
programme.desc: The citizens of the sleepy little town of Centerville find themselves under attack by flesh-eating zombies when the dead rise from their graves.

programme.title: Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
programme.desc: Two slackers venture to Hollywood to sabotage the production of a new movie based on their alter egos.

programme.title: Girl in Progress
programme.desc: With her mom (Eva Mendes) seemingly too busy to pay attention to her, a teen (Cierra Ramirez) hatches a misguided plan to skip adolescence and jump right into adulthood.

programme.title: The Number on Great-Grandpa's Arm
programme.desc: An inquisitive 10-year-old boy shares a tender relationship with his great-grandfather, a Polish-born Jew who lost both his parents to the Nazis but was able to survive Auschwitz and make his way to America at the end of World War II.

programme.title: Victoria & Abdul
programme.desc: Queen Victoria faces disapproval from her inner circle after forging an unlikely and devoted friendship with Abdul Karim, a young clerk from India.

programme.title: The School of Rock
programme.desc: Fired from his group and desperate for money, a guitarist (Jack Black) poses as a teacher for students who play in a school band.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The beloved Crawleys and their intrepid staff prepare for the most important moment of their lives. A royal visit from the king and queen of England soon unleashes scandal, romance and intrigue -- leaving the future of Downton hanging in the balance.

programme.title: Tower Heist
programme.desc: The manager (Ben Stiller) of a luxury condominium joins forces with a petty crook (Eddie Murphy) to steal back the retirement money a Wall Street swindler stole from him and his co-workers.

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: After a plane crash at sea, a Federal Express engineer (Tom Hanks) survives on a remote island for four years in complete isolation.

programme.title: Tiger
programme.desc: Highlighting Tiger Woods' unparalleled rise to fame and his complicated relationship with his father, Earl; the significance of his place in history -- as both a sports and cultural phenomenon --is undeniable.

programme.title: The Curse of La Llorona
programme.desc: Ignoring the eerie warning of a troubled mother, a social worker and her own children are drawn into a frightening supernatural realm. Their only hope of surviving the legendary ghost La Llorona is a disillusioned priest who practices mysticism.

programme.title: 30 Coins
programme.desc: Elena and Paco discover that a local mirror is haunted, and when Father Vergara spends the night investigating the mirror's trickery, he risks getting swept into its deathly portal.

programme.title: Walk of Shame
programme.desc: A woman's dream of becoming a news anchor is jeopardized by an ill-advised tryst that leaves her stranded in downtown Los Angeles with no money or transportation and only eight hours to make it to the most important job interview of her life.

programme.title: 30 Coins

programme.title: I Used to Go Here
programme.desc: A successful author finds herself deeply enmeshed in the lives of a group of college students after being asked to speak at her alma mater.

programme.title: X-Men: Dark Phoenix
programme.desc: During a rescue mission, Jean Grey is hit by a cosmic force that makes her infinitely more powerful, but far more unstable. The X-Men must now unite to save her soul and battle aliens that want to utilize Grey's mysterious new abilities.

programme.title: Daniel Sloss: X
programme.desc: In a performance from the Enmore Theatre in Sydney, Australia, the Scottish comic skewers society's gender constructs and mines his own personal experiences to reveal the humor inherent in today's fraught masculinity.

programme.title: The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: British retirees (Judi Dench, Maggie Smith, Bill Nighy) move to India to live out their golden years and find that their new home is a dilapidated hotel.

programme.title: Chronicle
programme.desc: Three high-school friends make a discovery that gives them incredible superpowers, but their lives spin out of control when their darker sides begin to emerge.

programme.title: The High Note
programme.desc: Presented with a choice that could alter the course of her career, a superstar singer and her overworked personal assistant come up with a plan that could change both of their lives forever.

programme.title: The Many Lives of Nick Buoniconti
programme.desc: NFL Hall of Famer Nick Buoniconti's life story encompasses turns as a linebacker, lawyer, sports agent, broadcaster, executive and philanthropist.

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: An undercover police officer (Paul Walker) investigates a gang leader (Vin Diesel) suspected of stealing electronic equipment.

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: A former policeman (Paul Walker) and his friend (Tyrese) work with a U.S. Customs agent (Eva Mendes) to indict a launderer in Miami.

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: An attractive lawyer and Bridget's (Renée Zellweger) former boss (Hugh Grant) threaten her newfound happiness with Mark Darcy (Colin Firth).

programme.title: Cowboys & Aliens
programme.desc: A 19th-century gunslinger (Daniel Craig) unites townspeople, outlaws, and a band of Apache warriors against an extraterrestrial threat.

programme.title: Godzilla: King of the Monsters
programme.desc: Humanity's existence hangs in the balance when the mighty Godzilla collides with Mothra, Rodan and the three-headed monster King Ghidorah.

programme.title: Tiger
programme.desc: Highlighting Tiger Woods' unparalleled rise to fame and his complicated relationship with his father, Earl; the significance of his place in history -- as both a sports and cultural phenomenon --is undeniable.

programme.title: Alabama Snake
programme.desc: The story of Pentecostal minister Glenn Summerford, a man accused of attempting to murder his wife with a rattlesnake in the sleepy town of Scottsboro, Alabama, and the investigation and trial that haunted Southern Appalachia for decades.

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: During the era of Tammany Hall's sway, a young man (Leonardo DiCaprio) vows vengeance on the vicious gangster (Daniel Day-Lewis) who killed his father.

programme.title: The Hangover Part II
programme.desc: Hoping to avoid the mayhem that marked his friend's Las Vegas bachelor party, Stu (Ed Helms) opts for what he thinks will be a safe prewedding brunch in Thailand.

programme.title: Life Is Beautiful
programme.desc: With a game, an Italian Jew (Roberto Benigni) shields his son (Giorgio Cantarini) from Nazi horrors in a concentration camp during World War II.

programme.title: Mrs. Doubtfire
programme.desc: Estranged from his wife (Sally Field), an out-of-work actor (Robin Williams) masquerades as a nanny to be with his children.

programme.title: The Bee Gees: How Can You Mend a Broken Heart
programme.desc: Brothers Barry, Maurice and Robin Gibb find early fame in the 1960s and go on to write over 1,000 songs, including 20 No. 1 hits. This film follows the group's meteoric rise as they navigate the complexities of working so intimately alongside family.

programme.title: John Q
programme.desc: A desperate man (Denzel Washington) takes hostages at a hospital in order to force doctors to save his dying son.

programme.title: Something Borrowed
programme.desc: After imbibing too much at a party, an unhappily single woman (Ginnifer Goodwin) falls into bed with the fiance (Colin Egglesfield) of her best friend (Kate Hudson).

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: A Long Island school superintendent and his assistant are credited with bringing the district unprecedented prestige. That changes when a student reporter uncovers an embezzlement scheme, prompting Frank to devise an elaborate cover-up.

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: A fighter pilot (Will Smith), a computer whiz (Jeff Goldblum) and others fight back after 15-mile-wide alien ships zap Earth's major cities.

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An FBI agent (Keanu Reeves) turns California surfer to nab bank robbers who wear rubber masks of four ex-presidents.

programme.title: 30 Coins

programme.desc: Hulking lawman Luke Hobbs teams up with lawless operative Deckard Shaw to battle a cybernetically enhanced soldier who possesses superhuman strength, a brilliant mind and a lethal pathogen that could wipe out half of the world's population.

programme.title: The Art of Political Murder
programme.desc: An investigation into the truth behind the murder of Guatemalan Bishop Juan Gerardi, who was killed in 1998 just days after trying to hold the country's military accountable for the atrocities committed during its civil war.

programme.title: Wendy

programme.title: The Good Liar

programme.title: Dim Sum Funeral
programme.desc: The grown children of an overbearing Chinese matriarch reluctantly gather to take part in seven days' worth of traditional funeral rites.

programme.title: The Three Stooges

programme.title: EMMA.

programme.title: The High Note

programme.title: The Change-Up

programme.title: The Blues Brothers

programme.title: Hereditary
